law.catch_line: Disclosure of coverage levels in basic health benefit plan.
law.text:
An insurer that offers a basic health benefit plan shall disclose to all individuals, small employer groups and employer-organized associations prior to the issuance of a policy that the basic health benefit plan:
Provides limited coverage;
Includes federally mandated benefits; and
Excludes state-mandated benefits, except for diabetes as provided in KRS 304.17A-148, hospice as provided in KRS 304.17A-250(6), and chiropractic benefits as provided in KRS 304.17A-171.
law.history: Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 144, sec. 3, effective June 20, 2005.
